comment:
Best option to take art history!
Thorough lectures. Requires you to develop smart note-taking skills.
Quizzes require analysis/contextualizing content instead of just memory.
Drops lowest quiz grades of the semester to help with average, very generous grader on papers.
He's friendly, accessible, and cares about student success if you show effort.

I would absolutely take this class again. Professor Houseman is very passionate about what he teaches, and so long as you take notes and read the textbook, you'll be fine. He is also very generous when grading, as long as you can show you know the material. If you're interested in the subject, take him, if you're wanting an easy A, don't.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Houseman himself is a pleasant individual, but my qualms begin with his absurdly challenging quizzes/tests. He exclusively tests on niche and confusing content, so by no means are his quizzes/tests intuitive, even with studying. The notes that are posted are sparse and useless if you are not entirely engaged in every waking moment of his lectures.

For me, I am the type of student who likes straightforwardness and to-the-point notes/lectures, but this class's lecture notes are very vague. Yes, you do have to be in class to know what is needed for quizzes and tests, but sometimes it is hard to remember what the guy says in his lectures every time. Make it difficult to know the material.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty good and slightly boring, but very easy class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is probably the best option to take. He is a great guy and enjoys what he teaches. It is very lecture-based so you need to go to class since his PowerPoints aren't much. There are 5 quizzes and an accumulative final exam/essay. His quizzes are based on connections and context rather than straightforward questions or definitions.

Nothing special about him, but the class is relatively easy. You have to complete 4 discussion posts in total, and he let's you choose from different weekly ones. Tests are fine, but some stuff are based on what he says in lectures, as his ppts don't have much info. Final paper was writing an analysis on your art piece of choice. Overall easy.

mid at best. easy quizzes, one paper, long lectures, and interesting subject material. super passionate about art history but goes off subject a lot, super fast paced, and impossible to take notes for. attendance isn't taken but you need to be present to be successful or you'll get behind. get a study buddy/groupme for this class, it'll help a lot

Doesn't take attendance, but lectures are crucial. Posts his powerpoints later on but most don't have enough written info. Lectures on some art not featured in the textbook. You have quizzes online and 2 chances to retake, no lockdown, a compare & contrast essay, and cumulative final exam. Sometimes posts a study guide, but last min.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is nice and understanding, but class time is really just for the lectures. I was always thoroughly engaged during class because the content was so fascinating, and he teaches it in a very detailed manner. Quizzes are more difficult, but if you pay close attention and take notes you should pass. Fun course for anyone who loves art!

The lectures gave a lot more insight than what the textbook covered. 
The tests did require me to think carefully and so were a bit difficult, but they were manageable because I like like art, took good notes, and kept up with the readings. All the test material was from PowerPoints which he posted online each week for review.

Professor Houseman is my all-time favorite professor!  Surprisingly, I learned to love and absorb Art History. He is somewhat tough, mostly memorization. He is so friendly, kind and appreciates Digital Design. I took my daughter to an Art Museum in San Francisco and everything we learned in his class came flooding back.
He was a fairly chill professor, but his tests were very difficult. If you dont attend class you will not pass. His lectures are boring, and weren't incredibly helpful.

I took him online fall 2021. Easiest class. You only have to do 4 discussion posts out of many. Tests were not on lockdown. Museum project due at the end of semester and was really easy. The prof himself was super nice and understanding when I mixed up a deadline. This course only took a few hours out of the entire semester to do (for me)!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Very chill class environment. Take notes in class on what's highlighted on slides as well as his comments and you will do fine. No homework, and only 4 test with the lowest grade being dropped. Each test you get two tries as long as you make higher than a 50. One required essay and you have able time to do it. Req textbook found online for free!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT
